annotation.spannedText: Vaccination is the most effective method of preventing infectious diseases

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccination is the most effective method of preventing infectious diseases

annotation.spannedText: widespread immunity due to vaccination is largely responsible for the worldwide eradication of smallpox and the restriction of diseases such as polio, measles, and tetanus from much of the world

classMention.mentionClass: widespread immunity due to vaccination is largely responsible for the worldwide eradication of smallpox and the restriction of diseases such as polio, measles, and tetanus from much of the world

annotation.spannedText: licensed vaccines are currently available to prevent or contribute to the prevention and control of twenty-five infections

classMention.mentionClass: licensed vaccines are currently available to prevent or contribute to the prevention and control of twenty-five infections

annotation.spannedText: The World Health Organization (WHO)

classMention.mentionClass: The World Health Organization (WHO)

annotation.spannedText: Vaccines have contributed to the eradication of smallpox, one of the most contagious and deadly diseases in humans

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines have contributed to the eradication of smallpox, one of the most contagious and deadly diseases in humans

annotation.spannedText: As long as the vast majority of people are vaccinated, it is much more difficult for an outbreak of disease to occur, let alone spread

classMention.mentionClass: As long as the vast majority of people are vaccinated, it is much more difficult for an outbreak of disease to occur, let alone spread

annotation.spannedText: Vaccination given during childhood is generally safe

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccination given during childhood is generally safe

annotation.spannedText: Severe side effects are extremely rare

classMention.mentionClass: Severe side effects are extremely rare

annotation.spannedText: Attenuated vaccines have some advantages and disadvantages

classMention.mentionClass: Attenuated vaccines have some advantages and disadvantages

annotation.spannedText: they may not be safe for use in immunocompromised individuals, and may rarely mutate to a virulent form and cause disease

classMention.mentionClass: they may not be safe for use in immunocompromised individuals, and may rarely mutate to a virulent form and cause disease

annotation.spannedText: In order to provide the best protection, children are recommended to receive vaccinations as soon as their immune systems are sufficiently developed to respond to particular vaccines, with additional "booster" shots often required to achieve "full immunity"

classMention.mentionClass: In order to provide the best protection, children are recommended to receive vaccinations as soon as their immune systems are sufficiently developed to respond to particular vaccines, with additional "booster" shots often required to achieve "full immunity"

annotation.spannedText: The twentieth century saw the introduction of several successful vaccines, including those against diphtheria, measles, mumps, and rubella

classMention.mentionClass: The twentieth century saw the introduction of several successful vaccines, including those against diphtheria, measles, mumps, and rubella

annotation.spannedText: Major achievements included the development of the polio vaccine in the 1950s and the eradication of smallpox during the 1960s and 1970s

classMention.mentionClass: Major achievements included the development of the polio vaccine in the 1950s and the eradication of smallpox during the 1960s and 1970s

annotation.spannedText: As vaccines became more common, many people began taking them for granted

classMention.mentionClass: As vaccines became more common, many people began taking them for granted

annotation.spannedText: the benefits of preventing serious illness and death from infectious diseases greatly outweigh the risks of rare serious adverse effects following immunization

classMention.mentionClass: the benefits of preventing serious illness and death from infectious diseases greatly outweigh the risks of rare serious adverse effects following immunization

annotation.spannedText: vaccines are ineffective against disease

classMention.mentionClass: vaccines are ineffective against disease

annotation.spannedText: Some vaccination critics

classMention.mentionClass: Some vaccination critics

annotation.spannedText: vaccine safety studies are inadequate

classMention.mentionClass: vaccine safety studies are inadequate

annotation.spannedText: spreading unfounded information about the medical risks of vaccines increases rates of life-threatening infections, not only in the children whose parents refused vaccinations, but also in those who cannot be vaccinated due to age or immunodeficiency, who could contract infections from unvaccinated carriers (see herd immunity)

annotation.spannedText: vaccinations cause autism

annotation.spannedText: there is no scientific evidence to support this idea

annotation.spannedText: Many vaccines have been highly cost effective and beneficial for public health

classMention.mentionClass: Many vaccines have been highly cost effective and beneficial for public health

annotation.spannedText: Effective oral vaccines have many advantages; for example, there is no risk of blood contamination

classMention.mentionClass: Effective oral vaccines have many advantages; for example, there is no risk of blood contamination

annotation.spannedText: Vaccinations of animals are used both to prevent their contracting diseases and to prevent transmission of disease to humans

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccinations of animals are used both to prevent their contracting diseases and to prevent transmission of disease to humans

annotation.spannedText: The DIVA strategy has been applied in various countries and successfully eradicated pseudorabies virus
